page.title: 17Tumuli
page.content: There is a tumuli in our D Block. Another word for tumuli is barrow .This is a prehistoric grave mound.It is sometimes applied to a natural height e.g. Trentishoe barrow , Barnstaple which is 1500 feet high.The term means more particularly an artifical tunuli.This especially applies to one raised in the Neolithic , Bronze Age and late Celtic times.They are found throughout Western Europe,and in the Mediterranean area. The 2 tumuli at Matchams were built upon a natural mound.The larger east barrow at Matchams measures 188 feet high.
